q:
What is the output of the following HTML and CSS codes:

login.html

<!DOCTYPE html>
<html>
    <head>
        <link rel="stylesheet" href="styles.css">
    </head>
    <body>
        <h1>Welcome to HackerEarth!</h1>
        <div class = "mylogin">
            <form action="index.html">
                <p>
                    <label for="username">UserName</label>
                    <input type="text" name="username" id="username" placeholder="Enter your username"><br/>
                </p>
                <p>
                    <label for="password">Password </label>
                    <input type="password" name="password" id="password" placeholder="Enter your password" maxlength="8"><br/>
                </p>
                <p>
                    <input type="submit" name="clickme" id="clickme" value="Login">
                </p>
            </form>
        </div>
    </body>
</html>

Â 

styles.css

body{
    height: auto;
    background-image: linear-gradient(yellow 10%, green 85%);
    background-repeat: no-repeat;
    background-size: 100% 100%;
    background-attachment: fixed;
}
h1{
    text-align: center;
    text-shadow: 2px 2px 5px black;
}
div.mylogin{
    display: block;
    text-align: center;
}
form
{
    display: inline-block;
    text-align: center;
    border: solid black 1px;
    width: 20%;
    border-radius: 5px;
    margin-left: auto;
    margin-right: auto;
    padding: 50px;
    background-image: radial-gradient(orange 10%, blue 85%);
}
